coexistence_simulator.joint.jrc_algorithms.comm_triggered_radar

Opportunistic radar‑burst scheduler.

CommTriggeredRadar fronts two waveform generators:

  • A communications modulator (for example, an OFDM or single‑carrier PHY).

  • A radar waveform block (for example, a chirp modulator or Golay pulse).

Operation

  1. Application code enqueues downlink payloads with queue_bits(bits).

  2. Each call to next_tx_frame() checks the queue. If any bits are waiting, one payload is removed and passed to the communications modulator. Otherwise, a radar burst is requested.

This rule lets a single RF front end time‑share between data and sensing without tight coupling to higher‑layer MAC logic.

Classes

CommTriggeredRadar(comm_block, radar_block)

Schedule radar bursts only when no communications payload is waiting.
